author: Staff Reports
title: Prep Roundup: Oct 24
text: Follow @jdnsports Posted Oct. 25, 2015 at 6:30 AM WILSON | Jacksonville outscored Hunt in overtime in set three, but the Cardinals couldn’t maintain their momentum and were blitzed in the fourth set as the Warriors claimed the first-round NCHSAA 3-A volleyball playoff match 25-14, 25-13, 27-29, 25-8 on Saturday. The 27th-seeded Cardinals, a wild-card entry from the Coastal Conference, finish 10-8. “We were missing a lot of players (including two seniors),” JHS coach Destiny Ma’ave Kuewa said. “We worked hard to try to work around that, but Hunt played a great game.” Down 2-0, the Cardinals jumped out to a 7-1 lead in the third set and was up 10-4 before Hunt (18-6), seeded No. 6, rallied to go up 15-14 and was within a point of sweeping the match (24-20) when Jacksonville came back. A kill by Allexa Mitchels and a hitting error by Hunt finished JHS’ rally to force a fourth set, which was all Hunt. Jacksonville 14 13 29 8 Hunt 25 25 27 25 LEADING PLAYERS–J: Mitchels 9 kills, 1 block, 1 ace; Lowe 4 kills, 11 assists, 1 ace, 1 block; Marrero 7 kills, 1 ace, 1 block; Negron 3 digs, 1 ace. H: Abdus-Samad 19 kills, 5 blocks; Davis 15 service points (3 aces); Parrott 13 service points (4 aces). RECORDS–J: 10-8, season complete. H: 18-6, hosts Cleveland on Tuesday, time TBA. Cedar Ridge 3, Swansboro 0: Swansboro ran into a tough top-seeded Cedar Ridge team, falling to the Wolves in three sets in the first round of the NCHSAA 3-A playoffs. The Pirates were seeded No. 32 in the field of 32 teams in the East. “Cedar Ridge is a good team, but I thought we shot ourselves in the foot early by not doing what we needed to do, offensively and defensively,” Swansboro coach Kim Miller said. “We gave them a lot of free balls and they made us pay. But I’m proud that we didn’t give up.” Alex Watkins had 16 digs for the Pirates. Swansboro 7 9 13 Cedar Ridge 25 25 25 LEADING PLAYERS–S: Cantoral 5 kills; Brooks 4 assists, 6 digs; Watkins 16 digs; C: NA. RECORDS–S: 9-11, season complete. C: 21-2, hosts Eastern Alamance on Tuesday in second round. Lee County 3, Richlands 0: Lee County swept Richlands in the opening round of the NCHSAA 3-A playoffs. The Wildcats, the No. 3 seed out of the Coastal Conference, finish 12-9. Richlands, which was missing a starter because of a wedding, got 11 kills from Brooke Monssen. Richlands 15 17 10 Lee County 25 25 25 LEADING PLAYERS–R: Barnes 3 kills, 7 service points (1 ace); Monssen 11 kills, 5 digs; MacKenzie 5 digs; Devita 7 digs. LC: NA. RECORDS–R: 12-9, season complete. LC: 13-4, at West Carteret on Tuesday, time TBA. North Pitt 3, Dixon 0: North Pitt, seeded 11th and winner of 18 of 21 matches coming in, swept No. 22 Dixon in the opening round of the NCHSAA 2-A playoffs. Page 2 of 2 - Dixon 18 19 23 North Pitt 25 25 25 LEADING PLAYERS–D: Lay 1 ace, 3 kills, 2 blocks; Murphy 5 kills, 2 digs; Moore 1 ace, 3 kills, 19 assists, 5 digs; Silance 1 ace, 13 digs; Peterson 5 kills, 1 dig; Griggs 3 aces, 5 kills, 1 assist, 7 digs; Batson 1 ace, 3 kills, 8 digs; Williams 3 aces, 1 assist, 6 digs. NP: NA. RECORDS–D: 8-12, season complete. NP: 19-3, at Currituck on Tuesday, time TBA. SOCCER JCA 2, TCA 0: Steven Mantlo scored on a penalty kick in the opening half and Daniel Campos added a goal in the second as Jacksonville Christian Academy defeated Trinity Chrisitan to claim the N.C. Chrisitan Athletic Association title in Elizabeth City. JCA finishes the season 8-3-1. “I’m real proud of the boys’ effort,” JCA coach Paul Albaugh said. “They didn’t give up. They were relentless on the field.” And the future looks bright as well. “I’m excited because I have a very young team,” he said. “I’m only losing two seniors.” Up 1-0 at halftime, JCA also saw Trinity tie it up, but goalkeeper Jeremy Rice stopped a penalty kick before Campos extended JCA’s lead off an assist from Garrett Mantlo. JCA 1 1 – 2 TCA 0 0 – 0 GOALS–JCA: S. Mantlo, Campos. ASSISTS–JCA: G. Mantlo. IN GOAL–JCA: Rice (8 saves). TCA: Ray (7 saves). SHOTS ON GOAL–JCA 9, TCA 8. CORNER KICKS–JCA 4, TCA 7. RECORDS–JCA: 8-3-1. TCA: NA. TENNIS Brannan finishes fourth: Dixon junior Maddie Brannan finished in fourth place in the NCHSAA 2-A East Regional singles tournament at Greene Central High in Snow Hill. Brannan went 2-0 Friday to make the final four and earn a spot in the state tournament next Friday and Saturday in Cary. However, she fell 7-5, 6-4 to Currituck’s Sarah Dover in the regional semifinals and then lost 7-5, 6-3 to First Flight’s Caroline Cowan in the consolation match. (The Wilson Times contributed to the JHS-Hunt story.)
